thread.title: Chelsea hero John Terry warned there is no room for sentimentality as they chase the Double
thread.title_full: Chelsea hero John Terry warned there is no room for sentimentality as they chase the Double

author: John Cross
title: Chelsea hero John Terry warned there is no room for sentimentality as they chase the Double
text:
Sport Chelsea hero John Terry warned there is no room for sentimentality as they chase the Double Blues' captain set for a recall at Wolves has played almost solely in the Cups since his last league start in September Share Skipper Terry can help Chelsea reach Wembley — but would he be in the XI for the final? (Photo: AFP/Getty) Share   Thank you for subscribing!   
John Terry is set for an FA Cup return in Chelsea 's match against Wolves – but has been warned there may be no Wembley farewell. 
Club legend Terry is likely to come in for Saturday evening's fifth-round tie at Molineux, with fellow defenders David Luiz and Marcos Alonso set to be rested. 
The 36-year-old, who last started a Premier League game in September, played in the last round against Wolves' Championship rivals Brentford, and is clearly winding down his glorious 20 years at the Blues. 
Blues boss Antonio Conte warned the centre-half there can be no room for sentiment as the Italian chases the Double in his first season at Stamford Bridge. Terry has lifted the FA Cup as captain four times, in 2007 against Man United... (Photo: AFP/Getty) ...two years later, following victory over Everton.... (Photo: Getty) ...again in 2010, beating Portsmouth to retain the trophy AND clinch the Double... (Photo: The FA via Getty) ...and most recently in 2012, when they defeated Liverpool (Photo: Getty) 
Conte said: “John is working very well – I’m pleased with his work during the training sessions. He’s in good form. 
“This [Wolves game] could be a good solution for me to pick him and to start to play him. I’m pleased for his attitude, for his behaviour, for his work-rate. He’s showing me he is a great footballer but, above all, a great person. I’m pleased for this. 
“It’s very difficult to tell when a player is happy. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
